required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of the Ophthalmic Solution PRO-156 in Ophthalmologically Healthy Volunteers.
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Clinical Trial to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of the Ophthalmic Solution PRO-156 Over the Ocular Surface of Ophthalmologically Healthy Volunteers.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate safety and tolerability of the ophthalmic solution PRO-156 over the ocular surface of ophthalmologically healthy volunteers

detailed_description.textblock: A phase I, open label and unicentric clinical trial to evaluate the safety and tolerability of the ophthalmic solution PRO-143 over the ocular surface of ophthalmologically healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.description: The VA will be evaluated basally, without refractive correction with the Snellen chart. A Snellen chart is placed at a standard distance: 20 ft. At this distance, the symbols on the line representing "normal" acuity subtend. This line, designated 20/20 is the smallest line that a person with normal acuity can read at a distance of 20fs. the scale consists of 11 lines of letters of different size, the size of the letter gives a fractional value according to the visual acuity of the patient, the value is inversely proportional to the visual acuity, if the denominator is greater the visual acuity will be less. Line 1: 20/200 Line 2: 20/100, Line 3: 20/70, line 4: 20/50, line 5: 20/40, Line 6: 20/30, line 7: 20/25, Line 8: 20/20, line 9: 20/15, line 10: 20/13, line 11: 20/10. the results will be expressed as the mean of the denominator of the Snellen scale (scale 20/--) example. 18.5 ± 1.5, that means the final result is 20/18.5 ± 1.5

secondary_outcome.description: The tension of a healthy eye should be between 10 and 20 millimeters of mercury (mmHg). In Goldman-type Applying Tonometry, the cornea is flattened, and the intraocular pressure is determined by measuring the force of application and the flattened area.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With Epithelial Defects
secondary_outcome.description: the number of epithelial defects was evaluated by the application of fluorescein, Staining was performed with fluorescein which stained the degenerated cells and the mucus filaments present in the tear film.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Cases With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The presence of adverse events was evaluated by the number of cases.

arm_group.description: Drug: PRO-156 ophthalmic solution One drop of PRO-156 ophthalmic solution administered to each eye, four times a day for 10 days.

intervention.description: Drug: PRO-156 ophthalmic solution One drop of PRO-156 ophthalmic solution administered to each eye, four times a day for 10 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female.
- Age between 18 and 40 years old at screening visit.
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with one blind eye.
- Any ocular or systemic condition.
- Visual acuity of 20/100 in any eye.
- Use of ocular or systemic medication.
- Contraindications or sensitivity to any component of the study treatment.
- Contact lens users.
- Ocular surgery within the past 3 months..
- Pregnant, nursing or childbearing potential women who were not using effective contraception.
- Participation in any studies of investigational drugs within 90 days previous to the inclusion.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 32 ophthalmologically healthy volunteers were evaluated, to which both eyes, with no history of any systemic or ophthalmological disease, who were not using any type of medication, and who agreed to participate in the study and met all the inclusion criteria described in the section.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Only 30 were selected and 2 discarded because they met the exclusion criteria.

group.title: PRO-156
group.description: Drug: PRO-156 ophthalmic solution One drop of PRO-156 ophthalmic solution administered to each eye, four times a day for 10 days. PRO-156: Drug: PRO-156 ophthalmic solution One drop of PRO-156 ophthalmic solution administered to each eye, four times a day for 10 days.

baseline.population: The study population consisted of ophthalmologically healthy volunteers, with no history of any systemic or ophthalmological disease, with both ayes, who were not using any type of medication, and who agreed to participate in the study and met all the inclusion criteria described in the section and with none of the exclusion criteria.

outcome.description: The VA will be evaluated basally, without refractive correction with the Snellen chart. A Snellen chart is placed at a standard distance: 20 ft. At this distance, the symbols on the line representing "normal" acuity subtend. This line, designated 20/20 is the smallest line that a person with normal acuity can read at a distance of 20fs. the scale consists of 11 lines of letters of different size, the size of the letter gives a fractional value according to the visual acuity of the patient, the value is inversely proportional to the visual acuity, if the denominator is greater the visual acuity will be less. outcome.title: Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
outcome.description: The tension of a healthy eye should be between 10 and 20 millimeters of mercury (mmHg). In Goldman-type Applying Tonometry, the cornea is flattened, and the intraocular pressure is determined by measuring the force of application and the flattened area.
outcome.population: the analysis of the study population was by protocol with Wilcoxon test

reported_events.time_frame: The evaluation period was throughout the study (13 days) comprising 11 days of intervention plus 2 days of safety call

event.sub_title: Foreign body sensation in the eyes

event.description: rash located on the neck and face of the patient of a few hours duration, treated with a single dose of loratadine 10 mg

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: by contract only the sponsor has the rights to the results of the study, if the principal researcher wishes the publication or discuss for dissemination of the same can only perform them prior written authorization with the sponsor and its legal department.
